DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Verbatim CTCAE Version 4.0 Migration Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to capture verbatim or clinical description of an adverse event that was created using version 2.0 or 3.0 of the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) but migrated to version 4.0 of the CTCAE as part of regulatory and reporting requirements.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Verbatim or clinical description of an adverse event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unwanted effect caused by a drug or therapy.  Such effects can be drug related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another drug, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Change concept code to C41331 as C2861 is retired per EVS. dw

Property.preferredDefinition: a statement that represents something in words.

Concepts.definition: a statement that represents something in words.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created to capture AE for CTMS v.3.02 (and subsequent version) reporting.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Adverse Event Verbatim Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events Version 4.0 Migration Text
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text to provide a qualitative description of an adverse event._Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used._In precisely the same words used by a writer or speaker._A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event._A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A number with no fractional part.::4.0_Non-random movement of an object(s) from one location to another.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Adverse Event Verbatim Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events Version Integer::4.0 Migration Text
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.:In precisely the same words used by a writer or speaker.:A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.:Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.:A number with no fractional part.::4.0:Non-random movement of an object(s) from one location to another.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
In precisely the same words used by a writer or speaker.

Concepts.longName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
Concepts.definition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
Non-random movement of an object(s) from one location to another.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support CTCAE data in CCR trials
